channel.title: [Help] Cheat Client?
channel.description:
Yes, im currently making a cheat client for rsps's
But the question i wanna know is how do i get the rsps webclient to the program like example:
http://prntscr.com/d8zd7
How do i like set it so it loads the cache and you can play in that box?
And make it compatible with PI does anyone know?
After i get these 2 things done im going to start adding the tabs :D

item.title: [Help] Cheat Client?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Go away, we aren’t helping you here.

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Cheat Client?
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“Zonebird, post:7, topic:452896”]Just download the jar file from the website and then use as accordingly.

So basically what your saying is get the insidax jar or some sort of PI jar and install it into the java program im making?[/quote]

Lol. I don’t know where you got ‘install’ from; there is no installation whatsoever. Just download it and put it in the classpath (same directory as your source files). That way you can access it using reflection or BCEL.

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Cheat Client?
item.dc:creator: @Zonebird Zonebird
item.description:
@Zonebird wrote:

Just download the jar file from the website and then use as accordingly.

So basically what your saying is get the insidax jar or some sort of PI jar and install it into the java program im making?

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Cheat Client?
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“Zonebird, post:5, topic:452896”][quote author=Deltascape link=topic=555762.msg4068740#msg4068740 date=1344151865]
I also need to know how to make cheat client If you know how to use reflection then pm me please
[/quote]

Parse the page?

And where would i grab the client?[/quote]

There’s no point creating a “Loader” and then loading a client if you’re not going to modify it via reflection. Just download the jar file from the website and then use as accordingly.

By the way, if you use BCEL to turn all private fields public, does that defeat reflection, because then you can modify all the fields and methods directly?

Read full topic
